---

<column gap="tiny">

**Perception** +25; [precise](/Rules.aspx?ID=411) vision (low-light) 60 feet, [imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412) hearing 30 feet, imprecise [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=40) 30 feet (only when touching the ground)

**Communication** speech ([Arboreal](/Languages.aspx?ID=26), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Sylvan](/Languages.aspx?ID=10); [_speak with plants_](/Spells.aspx?ID=294))

**Skills** [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +22, [Forest Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +25, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +25

**Int** +4, **Wis** +6, **Cha** +4

**Will** +27 

</column>

---        

Rather than passing on when they feel their death approaching, a rare few elderly [arboreals](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=8) undergo a ritual of preservation. This rite fuses the arboreal's consciousness into a branch, allowing their spirit to live on within the object. The branch functions as a [_greater verdant staff_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=364), though the arboreal spirit allows only partners willing to safeguard nature to use the staff's spells. An arboreal who decides to become an _arboreal staff_ is more connected to shorter-lived species than others of their kind. Most choose to endure to share their knowledge with future generations, but they take a long view in ways that can be frustrating to their wielders.

 In addition to the activation and spells of a _greater verdant staff_, an _arboreal staff_ can cast the spells it holds as if it were the staff's wielder, though it usually does so only to benefit a partner. The staff also has [_earthbind_](/Spells.aspx?ID=94) available as a 3rd-level spell.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
